title: Path of Exile
review: like Diablo but free, easy to sink hours into

title: Divinity: Original Sin II
review: turn-based RPG with good story and great mechanics

title: War Thunder
review: oh god I don't want to think about it, probably put in more hours off Steam too

title: STAR WARS Jedi: Survivor
review: personally loved it and had almost no bugs, excellent story and visuals and fun gameplay

title: Warframe
review: haven't played in a while but was pretty fun with lots of content

title: Hearts of Iron IV
review: was sorta fun with friends but could never really get into it

title: PUBG: Battlegrounds
review: I suck at shooters but battle royales were a fun new thing to play with friends at the time

title: Sid Meier's|Civilization VI
review: couldn't quite get into it like I could the previous in the series

title: Baldur's Gate 3
review: great gameplay and story, lots of class variety, still making my way through

title: Divinity: Original Sin
review: a bit clunkier and more drawn out than the second game in the series

title: STAR WARS Jedi: Fallen Order
review: introduces great new characters and lore to Star Wars, fun gameplay too

title: PlateUp!
review: super fun and chaotic, if you liked Overcooked you'll like this (I think it's better)

title: Borderlands 2
review: always wanted to play this as a kid, finally did and it was alright

title: Sid Meier's|Civilization V
review: played this a ton before getting it on steam, super fun, the ideal Civ game for me

title: Factorio
review: I appreciate this game but it's just a bit too much for me, I don't have time to learn games as much anymore

title: Dysmantle
review: really surprisingly cool story and addictive gameplay, a tiny bit drawn out at the end

title: BattleBit|Remastered
review: really brought me back to my Battlefield 3 days, clearly comes from some devs who truly care about good shooters

title: Blacklight: Retribution
review: it was free at a time when my parents would never buy me games, otherwise would not recommend

title: Dying Light
review: good movement and weapon mechanics, have some really good memories playing with friends

title: Dungeon of the|ENDLESS
review: great little roguelite to play with friends

title: Colony Survival
review: really enjoyed watching some youtubers play it but on my own it got dry

title: Dark Souls III
review: I appreciate it for what it is but I am just not a souls enjoyer

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
review: obviously played so much as a kid on Playstation, really amazing game for me personally to see stuff in the distance and actually walk to it

title: Planet Crafter
review: clunky game with some awkward waiting bits but not too long and fun with a friend

title: RimWorld
review: absolute classic indie game, the number of hours would be much higher if it counted when I played the pirated version

title: Satisfactory
review: played in beta, got really annoyed with bugs that just completely blocked me, never played the full game

title: Warhammer: Vermintide 2
review: gets stale fast, story is too easy, but sometimes it's satisfying to just smash some vermin you know?

title: Don't Starve|Together
review: seems fun but the game doesn't tell you anything and constantly dieing is just too frustrating for me

title: Titan Quest
review: cool classic style game with some fun builds, but always got boring a bit too fast

title: Return of the|Obra Dinn
review: the best puzzle game I've ever played, cannot recommend more

title: Sonic Adventure DX
review: playing for nostalgia but wow this game is janky, and 1/6 of it is a FISHING MINI GAME WITH BIG THE CAT???

title: Astroneer
review: really cute game but super awkward controls and progression got a bit stale for me

title: Sniper Elite 4
review: perhaps gimmicky, but sometimes it's fun to explode a testicle in slow motion

title: Crea
review: just a sad Terraria clone

title: 7 Days to Die
review: extremely janky but a game that makes you come back every few years, played a ton off Steam

title: Far Cry 5
review: initially played a ton off Steam, but it's pretty dry, much worse than Far Cry 3/4 in my opinion

title: Sonic Adventure 2
review: much less buggy than the first game, so nostalgic and fun, but still a bit of a mess

title: Garry's Mod
review: it kind of is what you make of it, could be great could be nothing, for me it was just okay

title: No Man's Sky
review: one of the sad people who played this game near release when it had no content, never really gave it a second chance

title: Fallout 4
review: played a lot off Steam, it was okay but a bit too clunky for me to truly enjoy

title: Besiege
review: cute game, not sure I have the creative drive to put a ton of hours in though

title: For the King
review: honestly seems great but I just never got into it, no real reason why

title: Mechabellum
review: really good game but came into my life when I was struggling to enjoy games

title: Q.U.B.E. 2
review: average little puzzle game

title: CardLife
review: cute game, cursed to have tried it in early access when there wasn't much content

review: super weird story if I remember correctly, I see it won a labour of love award so maybe worth trying again

title: Rogue Tower
review: just your average roguelike tower defense

title: Counter Strike 2
review: oh my god this game is not for me, maybe would have liked it more as a kid

review: high rating because I watched a ton on youtube, but could never get into it myself after that

review: did not get me like Borderlands 2

title: Stronghold|Kingdoms
